address: Thị trấn Hậu Lộc, Huyện Hậu Lộc, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa
thought:
**My Analysis of the Administrative Address Mapping**

Okay, so I'm tackling this address conversion: "Thị trấn Hậu Lộc, Huyện Hậu Lộc, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa." My initial focus is pinpointing the province, which is straightforward: "Tỉnh Thanh Hóa." The good news is, according to resolution 60-NQ/TW, Thanh Hóa isn't slated for any provincial-level mergers, so "Tỉnh Thanh Hóa" stays.

Next, I need to understand what happened to "Thị trấn Hậu Lộc." I started by scanning relevant resolutions. Resolution 1678/NQ-UBTVQH15 focused on Nghệ An, so I bypassed it. 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15, however, caught my eye.  Line 10 specifically addresses "Thị trấn Hậu Lộc," stating that its natural area and population, along with those of several other xã (Thuần Lộc, Mỹ Lộc, and Lộc Sơn), are merged into a new xã called "Xã Hậu Lộc."  Bingo!

To solidify this, I cross-referenced the "New Wards" data.  Sure enough, I found a matching entry: `{"ward_code":"16012","ward_name":"Xã Hậu Lộc","province_name":"Tỉnh Thanh Hóa"}`.  I also noticed other Thanh Hóa entries like "Xã Hoa Lộc," but they aren't relevant to my current task.  There were Nghệ An and Vĩnh Long entries as well, but those were immediately discarded.

Therefore, my conclusion is that "Thị trấn Hậu Lộc" has been merged into "Xã Hậu Lộc." The pertinent resolution is 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15, particularly line 10. The new ward data confirms this, providing the details: ward code "16012" and ward name "Xã Hậu Lộc." I'm very confident in this mapping; it's a direct match.

citation.header: 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Thanh Hóa
citation.line: 10. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn Hậu Lộc và các xã Thuần Lộc, Mỹ Lộc, Lộc Sơn thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Hậu Lộc.
